Analysis of Priority Chemicals in Canadian Aquatic Biota
===============================================
### Request for Proposal

**Reference Number:** cb-4805-4244961
**Solicitation Number:**  5000065856
**Publication Date:** 2023-04-18
**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-05-18T15:00:00
**Expected Contract Start Date:** 2023-06-01
**Expected Contract End Date:** 2024-03-31

### Background

Environment and Climate Change Canada (ECCC) requires analysis of ultra-trace levels of contaminants in aquatic biota samples, primarily fish tissue, from water bodies across Canada. The contract will support the country's objectives in the Great Lakes Water Quality Agreement.

### Scope of Work

The contractor must analyze and report ultra-trace results for fish tissue samples submitted by ECCC, as requested. The contract will cover analysis for one or more chemical classes, including Per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS), Polybrominated diphenyl ether (PBDE), and Hexabromocyclododecane (HBCDD). Samples will be analyzed for lipid and moisture content.

### Chemical Classes

* PFAS: Analysis will include detection of ultra-trace levels of PFAS and their metabolites.
* PBDE: Analysis will include detection of ultra-trace levels of PBDE and their metabolites.
* HBCDD: Analysis will include detection of ultra-trace levels of HBCDD.

### Contract Requirements

* Payment will be based on the chemical class(es) requested and the number of samples submitted.
* The contractor will be responsible for method blank and laboratory replicate analyses as part of their quality assurance/quality control (QA/QC) program.
* ECCC reserves the right to award up to three separate contracts based on one contract per chemical class.

### Contract Terms and Conditions

* The contract duration is from June 1, 2023, to March 31, 2024.
* ECCC has a funding level sufficient to support the contract commitments.
